subject: p19844485
History: -year-old woman with shortness of breath and diastolic heart failure, pleural effusion and possible pulmonary edema.
Impression: AP chest compared to : There is greater consolidation at the right lung base today, which could be atelectasis worsening in the setting of persistent moderate right pleural effusion or worsening pneumonia. Improvement in perihilar opacification in the left mid lung may be a function of difference in radiographic technique. The area is not clear, whether it is edema or a second focus of pneumonia, is radiographically indeterminate. Moderate enlargement of the cardiac silhouette is longstanding. Dr. Was paged.
